sentences.en: At last there are signs of a rapprochement between our two countries.
sentences.cn: 最后我们两国间出现了重新修好的迹象.

sentences.en: Political commentators have noted the rapprochement which has been taking place since the old president died.
sentences.cn: 政治评论家们注意到老总统去世以来发生的友好关系.

sentences.en: The next step of rapprochement came a generation later.
sentences.cn: 一代人之后,两国关系的修复更进一步.

sentences.en: The rapprochement between France and Italy will lead to a conclusion of peace.
sentences.cn: 法意的谅解是缔结和约的先导.

sentences.en: There have been growing signs of a rapprochement with Vietnam.
sentences.cn: 同越南恢复友好关系的迹象日益明显了。

sentences.en: There're signs of rapprochement between George and his son.
sentences.cn: 乔治和他儿子间有恢复关系的迹象.

sentences.en: Without settling this issue, Japan regards any form of rapprochement with North Korea as impossible.
sentences.cn: 在日本看来，不解决这个问题，就不可能与朝鲜恢复任何形式的友好关系。

sentences.en: Yet, while the trading ties flourish, a broader rapprochement remains distant.
sentences.cn: 然而, 尽管两国贸易关系蓬勃发展, 更广泛的睦邻友好关系却仍遥遥无期.

words.tran_cn: 密切关系，交往；和谐一致
友好；恢复邦交；友善关系的建立

trans.tran_cn: 友好，和睦，〈外〉和解，恢复邦交
trans.tran_en: the establishment of a good relationship between two countries or groups of people, after a period of unfriendly relations
